description:
The Advanced/Lead Scientist, Energy Solutions leads H&V Battery Testing Laboratory and Research and Development activities for Battery products including absorptive glass mat (AGM) Lead-acid battery separators. Leads new product / process initiatives using established scientific techniques leading to commercialization of products.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Electrochemistry & battery lab responsibilities
Provide expert electrochemistry guidance to the Battery Product Development group.
Lead battery testing including characterization, life testing and abuse testing.
Continuously develop and improve testing processes and methodologies through revisions to test protocols, testing equipment for reliability, and quality
Perform benchmarking of battery evaluation of competitive products and competing electrochemical systems.
Contribute to product design aspects, understanding and utilizing impact of electrochemistry on lead-acid batteries.
Demonstrate proper safety practices and continuously improve level of safety for the Battery and Development laboratories.
Lead product or process development projects for products including glass mat and other wetlaid composites.
Work directly with customers and Sales & Marketing to develop new products for existing markets opportunities.
Utilize expertise in materials technology to plan, execute and evaluate laboratory, pilot and production scale development projects.
Apply appropriate Design of Experiment (DOE), Six Sigma tools (DMAIC,DFSS) and Stage Gate processes in development projects.
Patent novel inventions.
Communicate effectively, support teammate’s growth and forge collaborative relationships within the company and externally.
Communicate plans and results effectively.
Supervise laboratory technicians to perform technical work and support their professional and personal skill base to maximumize potential.
Influence scientists and managers at multiple locations.
Develop relationships with customers and suppliers.
Provide technical reports, papers and presentations to internal and external project stakeholders and to the greater battery industry.
Keep abreast of relevant industry, applications and materials technology trends through literature, seminars and market contact.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
BS or higher degree in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering plus 5+ years relevant R&D work experience in electrochemical systems OR completed Ph.D. in Electrochemical Engineering, Chemical Engineering or Chemistry working in the electrochemical area.
Experience working in a testing environment or in a design, process, or academic role that required test responsibility; electrochemical or battery testing
Proficiency with scripting languages and/or statistical software, Python/JMP
Clear analytical thinking, attention to detail, problem solving skills and creativity
Hands-on skills in battery cell construction, electrode preparation, tools and machining skills
Skill in 3D CAD modeling and familiarity with additive (3D printing) and subtractive (CNC routing/milling) a plus
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENT:
Potential musculoskeletal stresses from repetitive motion of arms/hands, standing for prolonged periods, performing frequent bending and twisting motions, lifting of light weight objects.
Steady hands and dexterity to perform tasks repeatedly and accurately.
Perform tasks that require constant state of alertness.
Work performed in laboratory environment with potential exposure to hazardous materials.
Work performed in production area with potential exposure to large equipment/machinery and loud noises.
Able to lift 20 lbs
